newsitem.title: USA: TVA sees 3-day repair at Browns Ferry 3.
newsitem.headline: TVA sees 3-day repair at Browns Ferry 3.

text.p: Tennessee Valley Authority (TVA) said Monday it would take about three days to repair a recirculation pump at its 1,065 megawatt (MW) Browns Ferry 3 nuclear power unit.
But it still does not know when the unit will be putting power back on the grid.
"There's a 72-hour repair time on it," said company spokesman Terry Johnson.
Asked when it would again be producing power, he replied: "That's an unknown...We have to determine the root cause (before restart)."
Browns Ferry 3 was manually shut Sunday due to an electrical fault in the recirculation pump's motor generator, Johnson said.
Browns Ferry 2, the facility's unit in operation, was producing power close to its 1,065 MW capacity, he said.
The Browns Ferry facility is located in Decatur, Ala and operated by TVA Nuclear.
